meanings.definition: A person who inks or writes with ink.
meanings.sent1: The inkers at the stationery store create beautiful calligraphy.
meanings.sent2: I bought a book written by famous inkers.
meanings.sent3: The inkers at the library had a friendly competition to see who could write the neatest.
meanings.sent4: Her father was an inker of stories, filling pages with his imagination.
meanings.sent5: The inkers in the old manuscripts added a touch of elegance to the text.

meanings.definition: Devices used for inking, such as pens or markers.
meanings.sent1: She carefully selected different inkers for her art project.
meanings.sent2: The artist's studio was filled with various inkers of different colors.
meanings.sent3: The inkers in her pencil case always seemed to disappear when she needed them most.
meanings.sent4: His collection of inkers was a rainbow of creativity on his desk.
meanings.sent5: The inkers in the art supply store were neatly arranged by type and brand.

meanings.definition: The act of inking or writing with ink.
meanings.sent1: Her inkers danced across the paper, creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent2: The inkers on the calligraphy set were smooth and easy to use.
meanings.sent3: The inkers in the classroom were excited to practice their cursive writing.
meanings.sent4: The inkers of history left their mark on ancient scrolls and manuscripts.
meanings.sent5: The inkers in the old fountain pens required a steady hand to use effectively.
